title: Police pursuing suspects stumble upon pot-growing operation
text: HARRISON COUNTY, IN (WAVE) - Officers pursuing two suspects by foot near Lanesville Thursday morning stumbled upon a pot-growing operation and meth lab, according to a spokesperson for the Harrison County Sheriff's Department. Deputies said Lanesville Police were called to the 3300 block of Crandall-Lanesville Road just before 8:00 a.m. Thursday and that two men standing in the roadway ran when officers arrived. During the pursuit, the suspects ran into a field on the property at 3341 Crandall-Lanesville Road. Officers who went into the field found more than 200 marijuana plants growing there, according to investigators. They also said police found remnants of a meth lab on the property as well as a white powdery substance believed to be meth or cocaine inside the house. One of the suspects, William Berkeley, 36, was taken into custody. Investigators said Berkeley lives at the home. Police were still searching for the second suspect, Damon Schnellenberger, with a K-9 unit. Copyright 2013 WAVE News. All rights reserved.
